name: unciliated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unciliated cell or organism does not have cilia (= very small parts like hairs) on the surface: The eggs adhere to the substrate and hatch to give a crawling, unciliated larva.
More examplesFewer examplesThe shape of the pupa is as the adult, but the wing buds are short and unciliated, and the antennae are held against the sides of the head.Gyrodactylids give birth to unciliated individuals similar in size to the parent. The larvae of B. octohamatus are unciliated and cannot swim.
